gurmukhi: AvDUq gwq mihmw Apwr ]sRuq igAwn isMD ib`idAw audwr ]mun mn pRbIn gun gn mhwn ]jnu BXo prm igAwnI mhwn ]55]
transliteration: Avdhoot Gadt Mahimaa Apaar|| Srout Giaan Sindh Biddiaa Udaar|| Mounndman Prabeen Goun Gad Mahaan|| Jan(u) Bhayo Param Giaanimahaan||55||
translation: He had a body of Yogis, whose greatness was infinite and he was the store of the knowledge of Shrutis (Vedas) and extremely generous; amongst the sages, he was most skilful and great and was supremely learned.55.

gurmukhi: kbhUM n pwp ijh Cuhw AMg ]gun gn spMn suMdr surMg ]lMgot bMd AvDUq gwq ]cik rhI ic`q Aivlok mwq ]56]
transliteration: Kah-hoon Na Paap Jih Chhuhaa An|| Goun Gad Sapann Soundar Suran|| Lanot Band Avdhoot Gadt|| Chak(i) Rahichitt Avilok Maat||56||
translation: The sin had not even touched him and he was elegant in virtues; the Yogi Dutt wore loin-cloth and seeing him, mother was wonder-struck.56.

gurmukhi: sMnXws dyv AnBUq AMg ]lwjMq dyK ijih duiq AnMg ]mun d`q dyv sMnXws rwj ]ijh sDy srb sMnXws swj ]57]
transliteration: Sannyaas Dev Anbhoot An|| Laajant Dekh Jih(i) Dout(i) Anan|| Mounnddatt Dev Sannyaas Raaj|| Jih Sadhe Sarab Sannyaas Saaj||57||
translation: Seeing the greatest Sannyasi Dutt, having comely limbs, even the god of love felt shy ; the sage Dutt was the king of Sannyasis and he had practiced all kinds of the activities of Sannyas.57.

gurmukhi: prmM pivqR jw ky srIr ]kbhU n kwm ik`no ADIr ]jt jog jws soBMq sIs ]As Drw rUp sMnXws eIs ]58]
transliteration: Paramannd Pavitra Jaa Ke Dareer|| Kah-hoo Na Kaam Kinno Adheer|| Jat Jog Jaas Sobhant Sees|| As Dharaa Roop Sannyaas Ees||58||
translation: His body was immaculate, which had never been troubled by lust; on his head there was a tuft of matted locks; such a form was adopted by Dutt, the incarnation of Rudra.58.

gurmukhi: AwBw Apwr kiQ skY kaun ]sun rhY j`C gMDRb maun ]cik rihE bHm AwBw ibcwr ]lwjXo AnMg AwBw inhwr ]59]
transliteration: Aabhaa Apaar Kath(i) Sakai Kaoun|| Soun Rahai Jachchh Gaddhrab Maoun|| Chak(i) Rahio Brahm Aabhaaaa Bichaar|| Laajyo Anan Aabhaa Nihaar||59||
translation: Who can describe his fine glory ? And listening to his appreciation, the Yakshas and Gandharvas become silent; Brahma was also wonder-struck to see his glory; and even the god of love felt shy on seeing his beauty.59.

gurmukhi: Aiq igAwnvMq krmn pRbIn ]An Aws gwq hir ky ADIn ]Cib idpq kot sUrj pRmwn ]ck rhw cMd liK Awsmwn ]60]
transliteration: At(i) Giaanvant Karman Prabeen|| An Aas Gadt Har(i) Ke Adheen|| Chhab(i) Dipat Kot Sooraj Pramaan|| Chak Rahaa Channd Lakh(i) Aasmaan||60||
translation: He was extremely learned, expert in actions, beyond the desires and obedient to the Lord; his elegance was like the crores of suns and the moon was also wonder-struck on seeing him.60.

gurmukhi: aupijXw Awp iek jog rUp ]pun lgy jog swDn AnUp ]giH piRQm Cwif auiT clw d`q ]prmM pivqR inrmlI m`iq ]61]
transliteration: Oupjiyaa Aap Ik Jog Roop|| Poun Lage Jog Saadhan Anoop|| Grah(i) Pritham Chhaad(i) Outh(i) Chalaa Datt|| Paramannd Pavitra Nirmalimatt(i)||61||
translation: He had manifested as the apparent form of yoga and then had been absorbed in the practice of Yoga; that immaculate Dutt of pure intellect did the first thing of leaving his home.61.

gurmukhi: jb kIn jog bhu idn pRmwn ]qb kwl dyv rIJy inDwn ]iem BeI ibEm bwxI bnwie ]qum suxhu bYn sMnXws rwie ]62]
transliteration: Jab Keen Jog Bhu Deen Pramaan|| Tab Kaal Dev Reejhe Nidhaan|| Im Bhaibiom Baanibanaae|| Toum Sounoh Bain Sannyaas Raae||62||
translation: When he practiced Yoga for a long time, Kaldev (the Lord) was pleased with him; at that time, there was a heavenly voice; “O king of Yogis ! Listen to what I say.”62.
Voice from heaven addressed to Dutt :

gurmukhi: gur hIx mukq nhI hoq d`q ]quih kho bwq suin ibml m`q ]guir krih piRQm qb hoih mukiq ]kih dIn kwl iqh jog jugiq ]63]
transliteration: Gur Heen Moukat Nahihot Datt|| Tuh(i) Kaho Baat Soun(i) Bimal Matt|| Gur(i) Karah(i) Pritham Tab Hoh(i) Moukat(i)|| Kah(i) Deen Kaal Tih Jog Jougad(i)||63||
translation: “O Dutt ! Listen to me with pure intellect; I say unto you that there can be no salvation without the Guru; first of all, adopt a Guru, then you will be redeemed, in this way, KAL told the method of Yoga to Dutt.63.

gurmukhi: bhu BwNq d`q dMfvq kIn ]Awsw ibrihq hir ko ADIn ]bhu BwNq jog swDnw swD ]Awd`g jog mihmw AgwD ]64]
transliteration: Bahu Bhaant Datt Dandvat Keen|| Aasaa Beer-heet Har(i) Ko Adheen|| Bahu Bhaant Jog Saadhnaa Saadh|| Aadagg Jog Mahimaa Agaddh||64||
translation: Obedient to the Lord and abiding beyond the desires, Dutt prostrated before the Lord in various ways; he practiced Yoga in different ways and spread the exaltation of Yoga.64.

gurmukhi: qb nmSkwr kir d`q dyv ]aucrMq prm ausqiq AByv ]jogIn jog rwjwn rwj ]AnBUq AMg jh qh ibrwj ]65]
transliteration: Tab Namashkaar Kar(i) Datt Dev|| Ouchrant Param Oustat(i) Abhev|| Jogeen Jog Raajaan Raaj|| Anbhootan Jah Tah Biraaj||65||
translation: Then Dutt, bowing before the Lord, eulogized the Unmanifested Brahman who is the Sovereign of Sovereigns, the supreme Yogi and with unique limbs pervades everywhere.65

gurmukhi: jl Ql ibXwp ijh qyj eyk ]gwvMq jwsu muin gn Anyk ]ijh nyq nyq BwKMq ingm ]qy Awid AMq m`Dh Agm ]66]
transliteration: Jal Thal Biyaap Jih Tej Ek|| Gadvant Jaas(u) Mounndi) Gad Anek|| Jih Net Net Bhaakhannddnigad|| Te Aadh Ant Maddhah Agad||66||
translation: The splendour of that Lord Pervades in after an on plain and many sages sing His Praises; He, whom the Vedas etc. call “Neti, neti” (not this, not this), that Lord is eternal and Pervades in beginning, in the middle and at the end.66.
